intro: Waltheria albicans, commonly known as the white marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
